intro: Cumaruna, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Cumaruna is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common ornamental plant, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
